item.title: VIEW 美国 6 月消费者价格如期上涨
item.description: 美国消费者价格在 6 月份回升，这可能标志着人们期待已久的关税引发的通胀开始上升，使美联储对恢复降息保持谨慎。【原文：U.S. consumer prices picked up in June, likely marking the start of a long-anticipated tariff-induced increase in inflation that has kept the Federal Reserve cautious about resuming its interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国银行业巨头从交易反弹中获益
item.description: 美国大型银行周二公布的财报显示，在第二季度交易反弹之后，它们对今年下半年的投资银行前景表示乐观。【原文：Large U.S. banks expressed optimism about the investment banking outlook for the rest of the year after dealmaking rebounded in the second quarter, as they reported in earnings on Tuesday.】

item.title: 随着特斯拉机器人出租车服务的扩展，Alphabet 旗下 Waymo 公司的发展速度也在加快
item.description: Alphabet的Waymo机器人自动驾驶汽车在没有人类驾驶的情况下已经行驶了超过1亿英里，在大约六个月的时间里行驶里程翻了一番，该公司的一位高级官员表示，在竞争日益激烈的情况下，该公司正在加快在美国城市的部署。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo robotaxis have driven more than 100 million miles without a human behind the wheel, doubling the mileage in about six months, a top company official said, as it speeds up deployment in U.S. cities amid rising competition.】

item.title: 博通推出新型战斧 Ultra 网络芯片，与英伟达展开人工智能大战
item.description: 博通公司（Broadcom）的芯片部门周二发布了一款新型网络处理器，旨在加快人工智能数据运算速度，这需要将数百个芯片串联起来协同工作。【原文：Broadcom's chip unit unveiled on Tuesday a new networking processor that aims to speed artificial intelligence data crunching, which requires stringing together hundreds of chips that work together.】

item.title: 通胀报告公布后，交易员坚持押注美联储 9 月降息
item.description: 周二，在一份政府报告显示上个月消费者物价普遍预期上涨之后，交易商们继续押注美联储很可能会在 9 月份之前开始削减短期借贷成本。【原文：The Federal Reserve will likely be able to start cutting short-term borrowing costs by September, traders continued to bet on Tuesday, after a government report showed a widely expected increase in consumer prices last month.】

item.title: 中国国有汽车制造商广汽集团和江淮汽车预测第二季度亏损将创历史新高
item.description: 广州汽车集团（GAC）和江淮汽车集团（JAC Group）预计将于下月公布其有史以来最大的第二季度亏损，因为这两家中国国有汽车制造商正努力应对国内外的竞争。【原文：Guangzhou Automobile Group (GAC) and JAC Group expect to post their biggest ever second-quarter losses next month, as the state-owned Chinese automakers struggle with competition at home and abroad.】

item.title: 加拿大 6 月年度通胀率略升至 1.9
item.description: 周二的数据显示，由于汽车、服装和鞋类价格的上涨推动了通胀指数的上升，加拿大6月份的年通胀率升至1.9%，达到了分析师的预期。【原文：Canada's annual inflation rate rose to 1.9% in June, meeting analysts' expectations, as increases in the price of automobiles and clothing and footwear pushed the index higher, data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 新闻集团宣布新的 10 亿美元股票回购计划
item.description: 新闻集团（News Corp）周二表示，其董事会已授权一项新的 10 亿美元股票回购计划。【原文：News Corp said on Tuesday its board has authorized a new $1 billion stock repurchase program.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席执行官戴蒙称美联储的独立性 "绝对重要
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）周二表示，美联储的独立性 "绝对至关重要"。【原文：JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon said on Tuesday the independence of the Federal Reserve is "absolutely critical".】

item.title: 优步与中国百度合作，在国际市场部署自动驾驶出租车
item.description: 优步（Uber）和中国百度周二表示，双方将合作在美国和中国大陆以外的全球多个市场的优步平台上部署数千辆百度的Apollo Go自动驾驶汽车。【原文：Uber and China's Baidu will partner to deploy thousands of Baidu’s Apollo Go autonomous vehicles on the Uber platform across several global markets outside the United States and mainland China, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 苹果公司向稀土矿运营商 MP Materials 投资 5 亿美元
item.description: 苹果公司周二表示，将向稀土矿运营商 MP Materials 公司投资 5 亿美元，因为这家 iPhone 制造商正在寻求实现其矿产供应链的本地化。【原文：Apple said on Tuesday it would invest $500 million into rare earths mine operator MP Materials , as the iPhone maker seeks to localize its mineral supply chain.】

item.title: 花旗集团利润超出预期，主要得益于贸易和交易意外之财
item.description: 周二，花旗集团的季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，原因是其交易员从动荡的市场中获得了一笔意外之财，而投资银行家则从弹性交易中获得了收益。【原文：Citigroup's quarterly profit beat Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, as its traders brought in a windfall from turbulent markets and investment bankers gained from resilient dealmaking.】

item.title: 欧佩克称下半年世界经济可能好转
item.description: 欧佩克表示，尽管存在贸易冲突，但全球经济下半年的表现可能好于预期，炼油厂的原油摄入量将保持高位，以满足夏季旅游的增加，这有助于支撑需求前景。【原文：OPEC said the global economy may perform better than expected in the second half of the year despite trade conflicts and that refineries’ crude intake would remain elevated to meet the uptick in summer travel, helping to support the demand outlook.】

item.title: 尽管债务负担和通胀担忧加剧，美国国债收益率预测仍保持不变
item.description: 未来几个月，美国国债收益率将在狭窄区间内波动，路透社调查的绝大多数债券策略师预测，国债需求将落后于预期的大量新增供应。【原文：U.S. Treasury yields will trade in a tight range over the coming months, with a strong majority of bond strategists surveyed by Reuters predicting demand for Treasuries lagging an expected deluge of new supply.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国财政部长贝森特表示，鲍威尔继任者的 "正式程序 "已经启动
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周二在接受彭博社 Surveillance 采访时表示，确定美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）潜在继任者的 "正式程序 "已经启动。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, in an interview on Bloomberg Surveillance on Tuesday, said that a "formal process" is already starting to identify a potential successor to Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 由于需求稳定，杂货店 Albertsons 上调年度销售预期
item.description: 本周二，Albertsons 上调了全年销售预期，此前该公司的季度销售额超过了预期，该公司押注在经济不确定性增加挤压家庭预算的情况下，杂货店和药店对生活必需品的需求将保持稳定。【原文：Albertsons raised its annual sales forecast after beating quarterly sales estimates on Tuesday, betting on steady demand for essentials at grocery stores and pharmacies as higher economic uncertainty squeezes household budgets.】

item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 据福克斯商业频道报道，苹果公司将向稀土矿运营商 MP Materials 公司投资 5 亿美元
item.description: 据《福克斯商业》周二援引多位熟悉该交易的消息人士的话报道，苹果公司周二将宣布向美国唯一的稀土矿运营商 MP Materials 公司投资 5 亿美元。【原文：Apple on Tuesday is expected to announce a $500 million commitment to MP Materials , the operator of the only U.S. rare earths mine, Fox Business reported on Tuesday, citing multiple sources familiar with the deal.】

item.title: 报告称，湿地消失可能给世界带来高达 39 万亿美元的经济损失
item.description: 根据《湿地公约》周二发布的一份报告，到2050年，全球对支持渔业、农业和防洪的湿地的破坏可能意味着39万亿美元的经济利益损失。【原文：The global destruction of wetlands, which support fisheries, agriculture and flood control, may mean the loss of $39 trillion in economic benefits by 2050, according to a report by the Convention on Wetlands released on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国汽车制造商比亚迪推出智能手机与汽车互联功能
item.description: 中国汽车制造商比亚迪（BYD）周二表示，该公司已在全线产品中推出了智能手机-汽车互联功能，可与华为、小米、Oppo 和 Vivo 等品牌手机兼容。【原文：Chinese carmaker BYD said on Tuesday it had launched a smartphone-car connectivity feature across its lineup, compatible with phone brands including Huawei, Xiaomi , Oppo and Vivo.】

item.title: 富国银行利润因不良贷款拨备减少而增长
item.description: 富国银行第二季度的利润有所增长，因为它为潜在的不良贷款预留的资金减少了。【原文：Wells Fargo's profit rose in the second quarter as it set aside less money to shield for potential bad loans.】

item.title: 摩根大通在利润增长后上调利息收入预期
item.description: 摩根大通上调了 2025 年的净利息收入预期，此前其投资银行和交易部门的强劲表现帮助其第二季度利润超过预期。【原文：JPMorgan Chase raised its net interest income forecast for 2025 after strong performance in its investment banking and trading divisions helped it surpass profit expectations for the second quarter.】

item.title: 利息收入增加，手续费收入增长，纽约银行利润上升
item.description: 华尔街银行纽约银行周二发布报告称，由于股市回暖导致客户投资组合扩大，利息收入和手续费收入增长，纽约银行第二季度利润大幅增长。【原文：BNY's profit jumped in the second quarter, the Wall Street bank reported on Tuesday, driven by higher interest income and fee revenue growth, as client portfolios swelled due to a recovery in the equity market.】

item.title: 谷歌签署 30 亿美元美国水电协议，这是同类最大的清洁能源协议
item.description: 谷歌公司周二表示，该公司已同意在全球最大的企业水电清洁电力协议中获得多达 3 千兆瓦的美国水电，因为大科技公司正在努力扩大高能耗的数据中心。【原文：Google has agreed to secure as much as 3 gigawatts of U.S. hydropower in the world's largest corporate clean power pact for hydroelectricity, the company said on Tuesday, as Big Tech pursues the expansion of energy-hungry data centers.】

item.title: IDC 称中国第二季度智能手机出货量同比下降 4.0
item.description: 国际数据公司（IDC）周二称，中国第二季度智能手机出货量同比下降 4.0%。【原文：China's smartphone shipments dropped by 4.0% Y/Y in the second quarter, the International Data Corporation (IDC) said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 截止日期临近，美国参议院将就特朗普削减资金一事进行表决
item.description: 美国参议院最快将于周二开始就唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的削减此前国会批准的 94 亿美元对外援助和公共广播支出的要求进行投票，这是特朗普对其共和党同僚控制力的最新考验。【原文：The U.S. Senate will begin voting as soon as Tuesday on President Donald Trump's request to slash $9.4 billion in spending on foreign aid and public broadcasting previously approved by Congress, the latest test of Trump's control over his fellow Republicans.】

item.title: 纳斯达克和标准普尔 500 指数期货上涨，盈利和通胀成为焦点
item.description: 周二，纳斯达克和 S&P 500 指数期货走高，因为投资者准备迎接华尔街主要贷款机构的财报以及通胀数据，这些数据可能会左右美联储多久会降息的预期。【原文：Futures tracking the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 edged higher on Tuesday as investors geared up for earnings from major Wall Street lenders as well as inflation data that could sway expectations around how soon the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates.】

item.title: 中国汽车制造商吉利将斥资 24 亿美元完全控制 Zeekr
item.description: 中国汽车制造商吉利汽车公司周二分别发表声明称，将以 24 亿美元的价格收购电动汽车制造商 Zeekr 尚未持有的部分股份。【原文：Chinese automaker Geely Automobile will acquire the chunk of electric-vehicle maker Zeekr that it does not already own for $2.40 billion, the companies said in separate statements on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特朗普与科技和能源高管一起推动人工智能发展
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二将与美国最大的几家科技和能源公司的高管一起在匹兹堡举行峰会，美国政府正准备采取新的措施来推动美国人工智能的发展。【原文：President Donald Trump will join executives from some of the largest U.S. tech and energy companies for a summit in Pittsburgh on Tuesday as the administration prepares fresh measures to power the U.S. expansion of artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 贝莱德资产因第二季度市场反弹而达到创纪录的 12.53 万亿美元
item.description: 贝莱德管理的资产在第二季度创下新高，原因是全球市场因贸易协议和美国联邦储备委员会降息的前景而反弹，一扫此前与关税相关的不安情绪。【原文：BlackRock's assets under management hit a new high in the second quarter as global markets rallied on the prospect of trade deals and interest-rate cuts from the U.S. Federal Reserve, brushing aside earlier tariff-related jitters.】
